function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases in multi-purpose urban gardens","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of remote work environment safety measures in multi-purpose urban gardens","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased density and social interaction leading to higher risk of disease transmission in the residential area","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Emphasized flexibility and adaptability of apartment units may lead to frequent rearrangements and changes, increasing the risk of spreading contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Formation of a large number of terraces and gardens increases the potential for social gatherings and close interactions, leading to a higher risk of contagion.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shared common spaces for socialization may become hotspots for disease transmission if not properly managed and maintained.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Open plan apartments and removable partitions may facilitate the spread of contagious diseases within the building.","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Conversion of spaces for gathering and social interaction may lead to overcrowding and increased risk of disease transmission, especially during a pandemic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Greening of flat roofs and creation of urban gardens may introduce new disease vectors and require careful management to prevent the spread of infectious diseases.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Accessibility via stairs limits access for individuals with mobility restrictions, increasing the risk of excluding this group from the space.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High population density in urban areas increases the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Implementation of urban agriculture may increase the risk of foodborne illnesses if proper hygiene and sanitation practices are not followed.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of adequate common spaces for socialization within the building","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Loss of community and engagement within the building","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited adaptability of apartment layouts to changing user needs","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited application of guidelines may lead to inadequate disease mitigation measures in residential buildings.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited access to common areas in dense urban areas may hinder the implementation of disease mitigation measures.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lower application rate of the resilient residential model may result in suboptimal disease resilience during the pandemic and beyond.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Complex relationship between users and their residential space","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of education and understanding among stakeholders in the design process","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependency on market value over use value of residential space","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Abandonment of earlier housing concepts","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"General impoverishment of architectural work","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overproduction of residential buildings due to market policy","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduction in goods solely viewed through market value","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Resilient residential model for pandemic adaptation","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of specific measures for contagious disease propagation in residential buildings","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Complex issue requiring a thorough and integral approach","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Affirmative attitude towards residential space leading to complacency","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid dissemination of new diseases and elevated risk of pandemics","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid mutation of microorganisms and adaptation as a cause of human diseases","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Methods applied should be non-life threatening, user friendly, and energy efficient","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"No significance was found in the effect of age and gender on droplet generation, potentially leading to underestimation of transmission risk in different demographic groups.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of influenza a virus dependent on relative humidity","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Effect of humidity on virus survival","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Positive and negative influence of temperature on virus survival","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Influenza virus transmission is more effective at lower temperatures, such as 5 c, compared to higher temperatures like 20 c or 30 c.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Enveloped viruses may have different survival patterns at different temperatures compared to non-enveloped viruses.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Public health interventions may not be sufficient to stop disease outbreaks in modern society, according to mathematical models.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airborne pathogens from sick person, building, or intentional release","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limitations of dilution method","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limitations of filtration method","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Filter surface adhesion of particles reducing enzyme filter performance","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Variable susceptibility of pathogens to uvgi based on cell wall presence and thickness","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact of relative humidity on uvgi efficiency","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate room air mixing and uneven distribution of uv radiation","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High room relative humidity above 75%","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Adverse health effects of uvgi on humans","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of uvgi system at higher air stream velocities","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Accumulation of ’dead’ pathogens on contact surface reducing effectiveness of pco method","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
